title: impl Ord for bool: optimization

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Currently, `impl Ord for bool` converts the `bool`s to `u8`s and then compares them.

On the playground,
```rust
pub fn using_ord(x: bool, y: bool) -> Ordering {
    x.cmp(&y)
}
```
compiles to
```asm
playground::using_ord: # @playground::using_ord
# %bb.0:
	movl	%edi, %ecx
	xorl	%esi, %ecx
	testl	%esi, %esi
	movl	$255, %eax
	cmovel	%ecx, %eax
	testl	%edi, %edi
	cmovnel	%ecx, %eax
                                        # kill: def $al killed $al killed $eax
	retq
                                        # -- End function
```

A much shorter (in instruction count) and almost certainly faster version taking advantage of the fact that orderings are represented by `i8` values -1, 0, and 1, is:
```rust
pub fn minus_transmute(x: bool, y: bool) -> Ordering {
    unsafe { std::mem::transmute(x as i8 - y as i8) }
}
```
which on the playground compiles to
```asm
playground::minus_transmute: # @playground::minus_transmute
# %bb.0:
	movl	%edi, %eax
	subb	%sil, %al
                                        # kill: def $al killed $al killed $eax
	retq
                                        # -- End function
```
